title: On the stability of solutions to random optimization problems under small perturbations
abstract:
Abstract
Consider the Euclidean traveling salesman problem with nùëõn random points on the plane. Suppose that one of the points is shifted to a new random location. This gives us a new optimal path. Consider such shifts for each of the nùëõn points. Do we get nùëõn very different optimal paths? In this article, we show that this is not the case ‚Äî in fact, the number of truly different paths can be at most \bigO‚Äã(1)\bigO1\bigO(1) as n‚Üí‚àû‚Üíùëõn\to\infty. The proof is based on a general argument which allows us to prove similar stability results in a number of other settings, such as branching random walk, the Sherrington‚ÄìKirkpatrick model of mean-field spin glasses, the Edwards‚ÄìAnderson model of short-range spin glasses, and the Wigner ensemble of random matrices. 

Key words and phrases. Combinatorial optimization, stability, spin glass, random matrix.
